intro: Elytraria macrophylla, commonly known as the broad-leafed flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its long, narrow leaves and produces clusters of small, white to cream-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides. It has fibrous roots and is part of the Poaceae family, which includes grasses. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and traditional Māori use.
